content: Click to 'account settings' pane - click the 'server settings' for that account and tick the box to leave messages on server
creator: davidsk

content:
Spent the next 4 hours sorting out the mess and rebuilding... Installed 139 beside 143 and then uninstalled... Fortunately it dragged 143 with it and I ended up with no Tbird... Ran every possible disk cleaner and registry cleaner I could find then reinstalled 139...

I got a clean install then proceeded to reclaim and rebuild the profile by copy/pasting from the old email accounts to the new ones then content comparing both side by side before deleting the old profile. By doing this I was able to recover the email account that 143 ate.

So far its been stable for over an hour and executed the timed mail checks after Tbird was completely reconfigured to its previous settings...

7 hours and 42 minutes from start to finish and I'm over it...
creator: craign1

content:
Go to TB menu bar > View > Toolbars and enable Status Bar.

If you don't see the menu bar on top, press the ALT key.
creator: siffemoz

content: Try this: enable IMAP in the web version of the Outlook account under Settings - Emails - Forwarding and IMAP - Let devices and apps use IMAP.
creator: siffemoz

content: I added several accounts (email address) using the same procedure. But yesterday I create a new account in Outlook that works fine but that is uncomplete in Thunderbird. It is the first one in the attachment. As you see IMAP was selected by default and should work...
